item.title: Report E-2025040455
item.description:
Report E-2025040455

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T01:00:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: CHASKA
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIRGAS SPECIALTY PRODUCTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Our driver hooked up his hose to begin the offloading of anhydrous ammonia into a refrigeration system. Once the hose was hooked up, the driver started pumping the liquid ammonia. After starting the pump, the driver noticed a small leak at the hose connection. The driver then attempted to fix the leak with out shutting the pump off and putting on his PPE. While tightening the connection he moved the nozzle on the hose causing an aerosol of ammonia that traveled past his face which caused eye irritation due to not having goggles on. The duration of the leak was less than one minute and the release was fixed by getting the hose nozzle tightened at the connection.

item.title: Report X-2025041372
item.description:
Report X-2025041372

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-14
  • City: MAPLE GROVE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO OF DELAWARE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: HAZMAT AUDITOR BROUGHT THEIR TRAM BY THE DMP AND SAID THERE WAS A HAZMAT WITH BOTH CLASS 5.1 AND 8 DIAMOND HAZARD LABELS THAT WAS OMITTING A STRONG CHEMICAL SMELL. INSPECTING THE PACKAGE RESPONDER FOUND 4 1GAL CONTAINERS WITH VENTED CAPS AND 1 CONTAINER HAD A VERY LOOSE CAP THAT ALLOWED SOME OF THE CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT.

item.title: Report E-2025040558
item.description:
Report E-2025040558

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-02
  • City: BENSON
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIRGAS SPECIALTY PRODUCTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 135005
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver was headed west bound on HWY 9 near Benson MN in snow/blizzard like conditions. He was approaching a 30 MPH corner and was moving at nearly 50 MPH. When he applied the brakes he was unable to slow down and ultimately lost control of the truck and failed to make a left turn. The truck exited the roadway on the right side and over turned.
